meanings.definition: A hard coating or covering on something
meanings.sent1: The ancient shipwreck had an encrustation of barnacles on its hull.
meanings.sent2: The encrustation of ice on the window made it difficult to see outside.
meanings.sent3: The encrustation of dust on the old book made it look like a forgotten treasure.
meanings.sent4: The encrustation of jewels on the crown sparkled in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The encrustation of rust on the metal gate showed years of neglect.

meanings.definition: The process of forming a hard coating or covering on something
meanings.sent1: Over time, the encrustation of minerals slowly formed inside the cave.
meanings.sent2: The encrustation of paint on the wall was a result of many layers being applied.
meanings.sent3: The encrustation of frosting on the cake was a messy but delicious process.
meanings.sent4: The encrustation of ideas in his mind led to a breakthrough in his research.
meanings.sent5: The encrustation of snow on the mountain signaled the start of winter.
